label: Figma
description: Arcade tools designed for LLMs to interact with Figma

tools.name: AddCommentOrReply
tools.description:
Add a comment to a Figma file or reply to an existing comment.

If parent_comment_id is provided, creates a reply to that comment.
Otherwise creates a new comment (optionally attached to a node).

parameters.name: file_key
parameters.description: File key. Can be found in Figma URL: https://www.figma.com/file/{FILE_KEY}/...

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The comment or reply text.

parameters.name: parent_comment_id
parameters.description: Parent comment ID to reply to. If provided, creates a reply. Default is None.

parameters.name: node_id
parameters.description: Node ID to attach the comment to. Ignored for replies. Default is None.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: X position offset on the node. Only used with node_id. Default is None.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Y position offset on the node. Only used with node_id. Default is None.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ExportImage
tools.description:
Export Figma frames/nodes as images.

Returns temporary URLs to download images. URLs valid for approximately 14 days.

parameters.name: file_key
parameters.description: File key. Can be found in Figma URL: https://www.figma.com/file/{FILE_KEY}/...

parameters.name: node_ids
parameters.description: List of node IDs to export as images.

parameters.name: image_format
parameters.description: Image format. Default is png.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: Scale factor (0.01 to 4.0). Only applies to PNG/JPG. Default is 1.0.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetComments
tools.description:
Get comments on a Figma file.

Returns comments with pagination support.

parameters.name: file_key
parameters.description: File key. Can be found in Figma URL: https://www.figma.com/file/{FILE_KEY}/...

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting offset for pagination. Default is 0.

parameters.name: max_items
parameters.description: Maximum number of comments to return (1-50). Default is 10.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetComponent
tools.description: Get metadata for a specific component by its key.

parameters.name: component_key
parameters.description: The unique component key.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetComponents
tools.description:
Get published components from a file or team library.

For file: Returns all published components in the file.
For team: Returns paginated list of components across team library.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Source type: 'file' for a specific file, 'team' for team library.

parameters.name: source_id
parameters.description: File key (if source='file') or team ID (if source='team').

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of items per page (team mode only, 1-50). Default is 10.

parameters.name: after_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for next page (team mode only). Default is None.

output.description: Published components from file or team library

tools.description:
Get metadata for a specific component set by its key.

A component set is a group of related component variants.

parameters.description: The unique component set key.

tools.name: GetComponentSets
tools.description:
Get published component sets (groups of component variants) from a file or team library.

Component sets are groups of related component variants, like a Button
with states: default, hover, pressed, disabled.

For file: Returns all published component sets in the file.
For team: Returns paginated list of component sets across team library.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Source type: 'file' for a specific file, 'team' for team library.

parameters.name: source_id
parameters.description: File key (if source='file') or team ID (if source='team').

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of items per page (team mode only, 1-50). Default is 10.

parameters.name: after_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for next page (team mode only). Default is None.

output.description: Published component sets from file or team library

tools.name: GetFile
tools.description:
Get a Figma file's structure including pages and metadata.

Returns the file name, version, thumbnail, and list of pages.
Use depth parameter to limit how much of the tree is returned for large files.

parameters.name: file_key
parameters.description: File key. Can be found in Figma URL: https://www.figma.com/file/{FILE_KEY}/...

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: How deep to traverse the node tree. Default traverses full depth. Use 1 for pages only, 2 for pages and top-level frames

output.description: File structure with pages and metadata

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetFileNodes
tools.description:
Get specific nodes from a Figma file by their IDs.

Returns the requested nodes with their properties and optionally their children.
Use this to fetch specific parts of a file without loading the entire document.

parameters.name: file_key
parameters.description: File key. Can be found in Figma URL: https://www.figma.com/file/{FILE_KEY}/...

parameters.name: node_ids
parameters.description: List of node IDs to retrieve. Node IDs can be found in Figma URL after ?node-id= parameter (URL encoded, e.g., '0:1' or '1-2').

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: How deep to traverse from each node. Use 1 for direct children only. Default returns all descendants.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetPages
tools.description:
Get a list of pages in a Figma file.

Returns page IDs and names without the full node tree.

parameters.name: file_key
parameters.description: File key. Can be found in Figma URL: https://www.figma.com/file/{FILE_KEY}/...

output.description: List of pages in the file

documentationChunks.content:
<Callout type="warning" title="Private OAuth app requirement">
The `projects:read` scope is **ONLY available in private Figma OAuth apps**. This scope is required for the navigation tools (`GetTeamProjects` and `GetProjectFiles`). 
If you need these navigation tools, you must create a private OAuth app through your Figma organization settings. All other tools work with public OAuth apps.
</Callout>

summary:
Arcade provides a toolkit for LLMs to seamlessly interact with Figma, enabling users to automate design tasks and extract valuable data from Figma files. 

**Capabilities**  
- Interact with Figma files, including reading content and comments.  
- Export images and retrieve component metadata efficiently.  
- Manage and fetch styles, components, and team projects in an organized manner.  
- Access user profiles and detailed file structures for enhanced design workflows.

**OAuth**  
- Provider: Figma  
- Scopes: current_user:read, file_comments:read, file_comments:write, file_content:read, library_assets:read, library_content:read, projects:read, team_library_content:read  

**Secrets**  
- None.
